ch.dermitza.securenio.test.variablebyte

Class MultiSocketClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.dermitza.securenio.AbstractSelector
      • ch.dermitza.securenio.test.variablebyte.MultiSocketClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HandshakeListener, TaskListener, TimeoutListener, java.lang.Runnable

    public class MultiSocketClient
extends AbstractSelector
    A client implementation with multiple sockets, used for testing.
    Since:
    0.19

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiSocketClient

        public MultiSocketClient(java.net.InetAddress address,
                 int port,
                 AbstractPacketWorker packetWorker,
                 boolean usingSSL,
                 boolean needClientAuth,
                 int socketNo)
        Create a TCPClient instance
        Parameters:
        address - The address to connect to
        port - The port to connect to
        packetWorker - The instance of packet worker to use
        usingSSL - Whether we are using SSL/TLS
        needClientAuth - Whether this client should also authenticate with the server.
        socketNo - the number of sockets this client will have

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public void send(PacketIF packet)
        Send an PacketIF over the this client's SocketIF. Since the client only has one socket, no socket parameter is necessary.
        Parameters:
        packet - The PacketIF to send through the associated SocketIF.
        See Also:
        AbstractSelector.send(ch.dermitza.securenio.socket.SocketIF, java.nio.ByteBuffer)

      • invalidateSession

        public void invalidateSession(SocketIF socket)
        Invalidate the SSL/TLS session (if any) on the underlying SocketIF. As this client implementation only has a single socket, no parameter is needed.
        Overrides:
        invalidateSession in class AbstractSelector
        Parameters:
        socket - The socket whose underlying SSLSession should be invalidates
        See Also:
        AbstractSelector.invalidateSession(SocketIF)

      • handshakesFinished

        public boolean handshakesFinished()

      • initConnection

        protected void initConnection()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Initialize a client connection. This method initializes a SocketChannel, configures it to non-blocking, and registers it with the underlying Selector instance with an OP_CONNECT SelectionKey. If this client implementation is using SSL/TLS, it also sets up the SSLEngine, to be used.
        Specified by:
        initConnection in class AbstractSelector
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Propagates all underlying IOExceptions as thrown, to be handled by the application layer.
        See Also:
        AbstractSelector.run()

      • accept

        protected void accept(java.nio.channels.SelectionKey key)
        As this is the client implementation, it is NOT allowed to call this method which is only useful for server implementations. This implementation will throw a NoSuchMethodError if it is called and do nothing else.
        Specified by:
        accept in class AbstractSelector
        Parameters:
        key - The selection key with the underlying SocketChannel to be accepted
        See Also:
        AbstractSelector.run()

      • connect

        protected void connect(java.nio.channels.SelectionKey key)
        Finish the connection to the server. This method also instantiates an SSLEngine handshake if the underlying SocketIF is a secure socket. Finally, after the connection has been established, the socket is registered to the underlying Selector, with a SelectionKey of OP_READ, signalling it is ready to read data.
        Specified by:
        connect in class AbstractSelector
        Parameters:
        key - The selection key with the underlying SocketChannel that needs a connection finalization.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns whether or not this client is connected, if and only if it is running (returns false otherwise).
        Returns:
        whether or not this client is connected, if and only if it is running (returns false otherwise)
